caption_original: During the breeding season, scientists with Canadian Wildlife Service and counted a record whooping crane chicks in and around Wood Buffalo National Park – a substantial and encouraging increase over the previous record of in . Monitoring efforts now switch from boreal breeding areas to Saskatchewan’s parkland and prairie regions, where migrating whooping cranes stop for up to six weeks before continuing their journey to wintering grounds along the Texas Gulf Coast. We ask that anyone observing this endangered species to call the Whooping Crane Hotline at (306) -5595 : John Conkin ....

caption_original: Hey, Canada! Nature Conservancy of Canada is having a national online photo contest — Places Worth Protecting —to showcase beautiful places across the country. Protecting natural spaces preserves biodiversity, species at risk, and also helps fight climate change. Interested? Just share your photos on Twitter or Instagram by November , using the hashtag and you will automatically be entered in the contest for a chance to win an Essential Phone from Telus! For every entry, TELUS is donating $5 to the Nature Conservancy of Canada! Tap the link in our bio to enter today! Rob Wiebe...

caption_original: Brenda retired from the Canadian Wildlife Service in , but she still returns each June to participate in the continent-wide North American Breeding Bird Survey. She has been surveying these routes in Southern Alberta and Saskatchewan since and has now completed surveys! She is shown here surveying a route surrounded by native grasslands just outside of Drumheller in southeast Alberta....

caption_original: Canada’s national wildlife areas (NWA) are created and managed for wildlife conservation, research and interpretation purposes under the Canada Wildlife Act and in accordance to the Wildlife Area Regulations. For many reasons, but primarily to facilitate the administration of national wildlife areas, we are currently considering amendments to the regulations to modernize them. We want to hear from YOU! Let us know what you think about the proposed amendments. TAP the link in our bio for more info. Pamela Sinclair....
